header.div: Read this sample answer to the Writing Task in the last exercise and find the mistakes. There are 12. Click on them.

div.p: The flow chart illustrates the process which the Hong Kong Post Office is used to select suitable artwork for its stamps.

The first stages are involved gathering ideas for possible themes. District councils, tourist associations and government departments are all invite to send in suggestions to the Post Office. These are then forwarded to a special stamp advisory committee which simultaneously chooses between six and eight of the best ideas.

Prior to this, the committee may decide or to use the work of professional artists or to hold a competition and ask the public to enter their own artwork. In case professionals are to be used, three artists will normally commissioned to submit designs. The best of these will choose. Prior to printing, however, the design must be endorsed by the Secretary for Home Affairs. If, on the other hand, the committee decides to use amateur artwork, then a competition will be set up and publicised. Before entries have been submitted, the committee will be chosen the best and the winning artwork is sending for printing.

section.p: You should spend about 20 minutes on this task.

p.b: The flow chart below shows the process by which the Hong Kong Post Office chooses artwork for its stamps.
Write a report for a university lecturer describing the information shown below.

section.p: You should write at least 150 words
is used -> uses: 'the Hong Kong Post Office' is the subject of this verb in active voice.
are involved -> involve: 'The first stages' is the subject of this verb in active voice.
invited -> invited: Passive is needed here.
simultaneously -> subsequently: 'simultaneously' means 'at the same time' and 'subsequently' means 'afterwards'.
Prior to this -> At this stage: 'Prior to this' means 'before'.
or -> either: 'Either' introduces the first alternative.
In case -> If: 'In case' does not have exactly the same meaning as 'if'.
commissioned -> be commissioned: This verb is in passive voice in the future form, 'will be + past participle'.
choose -> be chosen: This verb is in passive voice in the future form, 'will be + past participle'.
Before -> Once: 'Once' here means 'as soon as'.
be chosen -> choose: This verb is in passive voice in the future form, 'will be + past participle'.
sending -> sent: The 'is' here is part of the passive verb. Present continuous is not appropriate here.
